about_the_game:
Summoned by Accident is a text based rpg focused mainly on m/m content with character driven plot. In it, you explore and run into inhabitants of the world. Some friendly, some foe. Inspired by other text based games and some videos.



You play as a visitor to the world who's trapped here till you can get a way back home. Luckily, your first encounter is with a short blue fox that seems to have the hook up. Able to get you a place to stay and even a new job as you wait. This, much like the inhabitants of the world, is something more than what first comes to eye. As you meet new people and learn what exactly you're being set up for, you'll be forced to choose who's allegiance you stand for. Even if that is mainly for one other person than group.



At first, you'll be restricted on what you can do. Exploring and finding about the little part of the city you stay at, but as you progress further in the story, so too does your freedom along with others. What starts out as you learning about the world and meeting new people, will evolve into you changing yourself to fit the occasion. Whether it's changing your looks for the right guy to be interested in you or people to give you the time of day. The way you fight so you can stand a chance against something you're dragged in to. Or just to do it so you can see that something special only a certain few can, you won't be leaving this world the same way you came into it.

content_descriptors.notes: Summoned By Accident contains furry (anthropomorphic) males. All sexual content is male/male in nature and includes characters drawn nude, engaged in sexual activities in still-image cut scenes, and frequent references to sexual activities including but not limited to innuendo. Characters have various preferences including but not limited to: BDSM, watersports, musk, inflation, mpreg, transformation, etc. The goblin race depicted in-game manufacture a high-proof type of alcohol. The rat race depicted in-game manufacture an incredibly addictive sexual stimulant drug. The player character can unwittingly imbibe either of these two substances but usage is infrequent and never forced.
